body: Is it different if you use Mapper.Initialize instead of Mapper.CreateMap?
I had the same problem. Configuring mappings within Initialize solved it. Thanks.

issue.title: AutoMapper 4.0.4 - How to fix this breaking change: Base class mapping is now default for derived class mapping

body: Yup. Same is the case with me. Mapper.Create map simply does not identify mapping for derived classes whereas Mapper.Initialize works.
Same here.. If it was not for unit tests it would have been likely to end up in production. Pretty critical bug..

issue.title: MapTo<T>() Invalid cast exception when mapping inherited types
issue.body:
See [AutoMapper issue 819](https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/819)

According to the comments in the issue, the fix is to use Mapper.Initialize instead of Mapper.CreateMap. Not sure how this impacts the MapTo extension methods or the AutoMap decorator.

body:
One other thing you can do is seal the mappings (this figures out all the dependencies between maps and builds out a mapping plan).

`Mapper.Configuration.Seal();`

I'll make sure and document this.

issue.title: Inheritance Mapping Not Working
issue.body:
I recently upgraded from V3.3.1.0 to V4.0.4.0 and some existing code that allowed me to map inherited source and destination types no longer works.

I raised an [SO](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/32513509/automapper-inheritance-mapping-not-working-after-upgrade-v3-3-1-0-v4-0-4-0) question describing the problem.

body: Sorry but none of the suggested solutions worked for me. I had to downgrade to 3.3.1.
@swilkos This is a different issue with the proxies, can you open a GH issue?
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
